q: Your ex texts 'U up?' at 2am. What do you do?
A: Block or ignore
B: Reply with screenshot of their text to the group chat
D: Screenshot and post on social media

q: You find out your friend's partner is cheating. What's your move?
A: Tell your friend immediately
B: Confront the cheater first
D: Create a fake dating profile to catfish them

q: Your crush posts thirst traps. How do you respond?
A: Like it casually
B: Leave fire emojis in comments
D: Slide into DMs with 'hey beautiful'

q: You drunk text your ex a paragraph about your feelings. Next morning you:
A: Own it and don't apologize
B: Pretend your phone was hacked
D: Double down and send another paragraph

q: Your partner's ex likes all their social media posts. You:
A: Talk to your partner about it
B: Block the ex yourself
C: Start liking all their posts first
D: Create fake accounts to mess with them

q: You see your friend's partner on dating apps. What do you do?
A: Screenshot and tell your friend
B: Swipe right to gather evidence
D: Make a fake profile to match and investigate

q: Someone ghosts you after a great date. You:
A: Move on and don't contact them
B: Send one follow-up text then stop
D: Show up at their workplace

q: Your one-night stand wants to be friends on social media. You:
A: Politely decline or ignore
B: Accept but set boundaries
D: Accept and then post couple-y photos to confuse them

q: You discover your partner has been sliding into DMs. You:
A: Have a direct conversation about it
B: Do the same thing back to them
C: Go through all their messages secretly
D: Post vague quotes about loyalty on social media

q: Your ex starts dating your friend. The mature response is:
A: Distance yourself if needed, don't interfere
B: Tell your friend all your ex's secrets
D: Date their ex to get revenge

q: You accidentally like your ex's post from 2 years ago while stalking. You:
A: Leave it and pretend it didn't happen
B: Unlike it immediately
D: Delete your entire social media presence

q: Someone screenshots your private story and shares it. You:
A: Confront them directly
B: Remove them from your close friends
D: Hack their account and delete it

q: Your crush views your story instantly every time but never messages. You:
A: Take the hint and move on
B: Make your stories more obvious
C: Ask them directly what they want
D: Stop viewing their stories to make them jealous

q: You find out someone has been talking behind your back. You:
A: Address it directly with them
B: Start spreading rumors about them
D: Create group chat drama about it

q: Your friend keeps venting about their relationship but won't take advice. You:
A: Set boundaries about the complaining
B: Tell them what they want to hear
D: Start charging them for therapy sessions

q: You see your ex with someone new on social media. The healthy response:
A: Feel your feelings privately and move on
B: Immediately post photos with someone else
C: Stalk their new person's entire profile
D: Send screenshots to all your mutual friends

q: Someone you rejected keeps messaging you. You should:
A: Be clear about boundaries and block if needed
B: Ignore and hope they get the hint
C: Be mean so they leave you alone
D: String them along for the attention

q: Your partner's friend clearly doesn't like you. You:
A: Talk to your partner about it calmly
B: Try harder to win them over
D: Start drama in the friend group

q: You realize you've been the side piece. What's your next move?
A: Leave immediately and tell their partner
B: Confront them and demand they choose
D: Blackmail them with evidence

q: Your best friend starts dating someone you hate. You:
A: Support your friend while being honest
B: Pretend to like their partner
D: Give them an ultimatum

q: You catch your partner in a lie. The mature approach is:
A: Address it directly and calmly
B: Set a trap to catch them lying again
C: Lie back to them about something
D: Post cryptic quotes about trust

q: Your ex wants their stuff back that's at your place. You:
A: Arrange a time for them to get it
B: Make them ask nicely first
C: Hold it hostage until they apologize
D: Burn it all and send them the video

q: Someone slides into your DMs with just 'hey.' You:
A: Respond if you're interested, ignore if not
B: Send back 'hey' and see what happens
C: Leave them on read to seem mysterious
D: Screenshot and roast them in group chat

q: You discover your friend has been copying your style/personality. You:
A: Talk to them about how it makes you feel
B: Change your entire aesthetic
D: Start doing everything they do back to them

q: Your partner's ex texts them asking to meet up. The healthy boundary is:
A: Your partner should decline or include you
B: Forbid any contact with exes
C: Demand to read all their messages
D: Meet up with your ex to make it even

q: You overhear someone talking about your private business. You:
A: Confront them directly about it
B: Start spreading their secrets too
D: Pretend you didn't hear anything

q: Your friend keeps canceling plans last minute. You should:
A: Talk to them about valuing your time
B: Do the same thing back to them
D: Make fake plans just to cancel on them

q: You find out someone you trusted shared your nudes. You:
A: Report it and cut all contact immediately
B: Threaten to sue them
D: Send worse photos of them to everyone

q: Your crush starts dating someone else. The mature response:
A: Respect their choice and move on
B: Try to prove you're better than their new person
C: Wait for them to break up
D: Sabotage their new relationship

q: Someone keeps viewing your stories but won't follow you back. You:
A: Accept that social media isn't that deep
B: Block them from viewing your stories
D: Create fake accounts to follow them

q: Your partner gets jealous of your friendship. You should:
A: Discuss boundaries and reassure them
B: End the friendship to keep peace
D: Make them even more jealous on purpose

q: You realize you've been trauma dumping on someone. You:
A: Apologize and find appropriate support
B: Keep doing it since they haven't stopped you
C: Switch topics and pretend it didn't happen
D: Get them to trauma dump back so it's even

q: Your ex reaches out wanting closure. You:
A: Decide based on your own healing needs
B: Give them what they want to be nice
C: Use it as a chance to hurt them more
D: Demand closure from all your exes too

q: Someone you dated briefly announces they're in a relationship. You:
A: Feel your feelings privately and move on
B: Check if it's the person they said was 'just a friend'
D: Announce your own fake relationship

q: You discover a friend has been lying about their life. You:
A: Decide if you can accept them as they are
B: Call them out in front of everyone
D: Make up bigger lies to compete

q: Your partner wants to post couple photos but you're private. You:
A: Communicate and find a compromise
B: Let them post whatever they want
C: Forbid them from posting about you
D: Break up since you're incompatible

q: You see someone cheating on their partner at a party. You:
A: Mind your business unless it's your close friend
B: Take photos as evidence
D: Post about it on social media anonymously

q: Your friend keeps bringing up your embarrassing moment. You:
A: Ask them to stop bringing it up
B: Bring up their embarrassing moments too
D: Create new embarrassing moments for them

q: Someone you're dating is still active on dating apps. You:
A: Have a conversation about exclusivity
B: Create fake profiles to test them
C: Screenshot their profile and expose them
D: Download more dating apps yourself

q: Your ex posts a thirst trap clearly aimed at making you jealous. You:
A: Don't engage and continue moving on
B: Like it to show you don't care
C: Post a better thirst trap yourself
D: Comment something petty

q: A friend constantly talks about how much money they make. You:
A: Change the subject or limit conversations
B: Start talking about your money more
C: Ask them to pay for everything
D: Make up stories about being even richer

q: You're in a situationship but want more. You should:
A: Be honest about what you want
B: Play games to make them jealous
C: Wait for them to bring it up first
D: Give them an ultimatum

q: Your partner's friend hits on you when they're not around. You:
A: Tell your partner immediately
B: Handle it yourself and don't tell
C: Flirt back to see what happens
D: Use it as leverage in future arguments

q: Someone screenshots your private conversation and shares it. You:
A: Confront them and set clear boundaries
B: Do the same thing to their conversations
C: Post about fake friends on social media
D: Share even more embarrassing stuff about them

q: Your friend's new relationship is clearly toxic but they won't listen. You:
A: Be supportive but don't enable
B: Keep giving unwanted advice
C: Cut them off until they break up
D: Try to prove their partner is toxic

q: You realize you've been emotionally cheating. You should:
A: Be honest with your partner and work on it
B: End the emotional affair quietly
D: Turn it into physical cheating

q: Your ex starts dating someone who looks exactly like you. You:
A: Take it as a compliment and move on
B: Feel creeped out but don't say anything
C: Message the new person to warn them
D: Post about how you're clearly their type

q: Someone keeps copying your social media posts. You:
A: Block them or make your account private
B: Call them out publicly
C: Start posting fake stuff to confuse them
D: Copy their posts back

q: Your friend won't stop trying to set you up despite saying no. You:
A: Be firm about your boundaries
B: Go on one date to make them stop
C: Set them up with someone terrible
D: Avoid them until they get the hint

q: You discover your partner has been hiding debt from you. You:
A: Have a serious conversation about finances
B: Start hiding your own financial secrets
C: Demand access to all their accounts
D: Leave immediately without discussion

q: Someone you barely know asks you to be their emergency contact. You:
A: Politely decline and suggest someone closer
B: Agree but never answer if they call
C: Say yes but give them a fake number
D: Report them to authorities for being weird

q: Your friend keeps asking you to lie to their partner for them. You:
A: Refuse and tell them to handle their own relationship
B: Lie to keep the peace
C: Tell their partner the truth yourself
D: Ask for payment for your lying services

q: You find out someone has been pretending to be you online. You:
A: Report it to the platform and authorities
B: Create a profile pretending to be them
C: Message people to tell them it's fake
D: Let it go since imitation is flattery

q: Your partner wants to go through your phone to 'build trust.' You:
A: Discuss why they feel the need to do this
B: Let them look to prove you have nothing to hide
C: Demand to go through their phone first
D: Delete everything suspicious then let them look

q: Someone keeps 'forgetting' their wallet when you hang out. You:
A: Address it directly or stop hanging out
B: Start forgetting your wallet too
D: Send them a Venmo request before every hangout

q: Your ex's new partner adds you on social media. You:
A: Decline or ignore the request
B: Accept but don't interact
C: Accept and like all their old photos
D: Accept and send them screenshots of your ex's messages

q: You realize you've been love-bombing someone. You should:
A: Step back and examine your attachment patterns
B: Continue but tone it down slightly
D: Find someone new to love-bomb instead

q: Your friend keeps posting about how happy they are but privately tells you they're miserable. You:
A: Encourage them to be authentic and get help
B: Call them out on their fake posts
D: Screenshot their posts when they complain to you

q: Someone you're dating says they're not ready for a relationship but keeps acting like you're in one. You:
A: Call out the mixed signals directly
B: Go along with it hoping they'll change their mind
D: Give them an ultimatum

q: Your friend constantly interrupts you and talks over you. You:
A: Address their interrupting behavior directly
B: Start talking louder to compete
D: Interrupt them back every time they do it

q: You discover someone has been reading your diary/private messages. You:
A: Confront them and secure your privacy
B: Start writing fake entries to mess with them
C: Move everything to a secret location
D: Read their private stuff in revenge

q: Your partner's family clearly doesn't approve of you. You:
A: Talk to your partner about setting boundaries
B: Try harder to win them over
C: Match their energy and be rude back
D: Demand your partner choose between you and them

q: Someone keeps making jokes at your expense in front of others. You:
A: Tell them privately that it bothers you
B: Make worse jokes about them
D: Roast them publicly next time they do it

q: You realize you've been the toxic one in your friendships. You should:
A: Take accountability and work on changing
B: Blame your friends for enabling you
C: Find new friends who accept your toxicity
D: Double down and be even more toxic

q: Your crush posts about wanting someone to ask them out. You:
A: Ask them out directly if you're interested
B: Like the post and hope they get the hint
D: Get a friend to ask them about you

q: Someone keeps trauma dumping on you without asking. You:
A: Set boundaries about when and how much you can listen
B: Just stop responding to their messages
C: Trauma dump back to make it even
D: Give them terrible advice so they stop coming to you

q: You find out your friend has been talking badly about you behind your back. You:
A: Confront them directly about what you heard
B: Start talking badly about them too
D: Gather evidence before confronting them

q: Your ex keeps showing up to places they know you'll be. You:
A: Tell them directly to stop or involve authorities if needed
B: Start going to different places
D: Show up to places they'll be to make it even

q: Someone you rejected keeps trying to win you over with gifts. You:
A: Firmly decline and return the gifts
B: Accept the gifts but maintain boundaries
C: Keep the gifts but don't give them false hope
D: Accept everything until they go broke

q: You realize you've been stringing someone along. You should:
A: Be honest about your intentions and let them go
B: Continue but feel bad about it
C: Find someone else to replace them first
D: Make them break things off so you're not the bad guy

q: Your friend keeps making plans and then flaking at the last minute. You:
A: Tell them how their flaking affects you
B: Start flaking on them too
D: Charge them a cancellation fee

q: You discover your partner has been lying about their past. You:
A: Have an honest conversation about trust and truth
B: Hire a private investigator to find out more
C: Start lying about your past too
D: Use their lies against them in arguments

q: Someone keeps borrowing money and 'forgetting' to pay you back. You:
A: Stop lending money and ask for what's owed
B: Keep lending but passive aggressively mention it
D: Add interest to what they owe you

q: Your friend's success makes you feel insecure and jealous. You:
A: Work on your insecurity and celebrate their success
B: Try to one-up them constantly
D: Point out their flaws to make yourself feel better

q: You catch someone taking photos of you without permission. You:
A: Confront them immediately and demand deletion
B: Take photos of them back
D: Post the photos they took on social media
